name: NCD - Percutaneous Image-Guided Lumbar Decompression for Lumbar Spinal Stenosis
description: This policy outlines Medicare coverage for Percutaneous Image-Guided Lumbar Decompression (PILD) for symptomatic Lumbar Spinal Stenosis (LSS). Coverage is provided only when PILD is performed within the context of a clinical study under Coverage with Evidence Development (CED) that meets specific criteria established by CMS, with different requirements for studies effective January 9, 2014, and December 7, 2016. Other open decompression procedures and endoscopically assisted laminotomy/laminectomy are outside the scope of this NCD.

restrictions.condition: The procedure performed must be Percutaneous Image-Guided Lumbar Decompression (PILD).
The beneficiary must have a diagnosis of Lumbar Spinal Stenosis (LSS).
PILD is covered only when provided in a clinical study under Coverage with Evidence Development (CED).
Beneficiaries must be enrolled in an approved clinical study.
The clinical study must have a prospective, randomized, and controlled design.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%prospective%' AND clinical_study_design LIKE '%randomized%' AND clinical_study_design LIKE '%controlled%'

restrictions.condition: The clinical study must use current validated and reliable measurement instruments.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%validated and reliable measurement instruments%'

restrictions.condition: The clinical study must include clinically appropriate comparator treatments (e.g., medical, surgical, or sham-controlled arm).
The study protocol must specify a statistical analysis plan.
The study protocol must specify a minimum length of patient follow-up time.
The principal purpose of the research study must be to test whether the intervention potentially improves participants' health outcomes.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%principal purpose of the research study is to test whether a particular intervention potentially improves the participants’ health outcomes%'

restrictions.condition: The research study must be well supported by available scientific and medical information or clarify health outcomes of interventions already in common clinical use.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%well supported by available scientific and medical information%'

restrictions.condition: The research study must not unjustifiably duplicate existing studies.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%does not unjustifiably duplicate existing studies%'

restrictions.condition: The research study design must be appropriate to answer the research question being asked.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%design is appropriate to answer the research question%'

restrictions.condition: The research study must be sponsored by an organization or individual capable of executing the proposed study successfully.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%sponsored by an organization or individual capable of executing the proposed study successfully%'

restrictions.condition: The research study must comply with all applicable Federal regulations concerning the protection of human subjects (45 CFR Part 46).
If FDA-regulated, the study must comply with 21 CFR parts 50 and 56.
All aspects of the research study must be conducted according to appropriate standards of scientific integrity.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%conducted according to appropriate standards of scientific integrity%'

restrictions.condition: The research study must have a written protocol that clearly addresses Medicare requirements for CED coverage.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%written protocol that clearly addresses%'

restrictions.condition: The clinical research study must not be designed to exclusively test toxicity or disease pathophysiology in healthy individuals, unless the condition is life-threatening and there are no other viable treatment options.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%not designed to exclusively test toxicity or disease pathophysiology in healthy individuals%'

restrictions.condition: Clinical research studies must be registered on ClinicalTrials.gov by the principal sponsor/investigator prior to the enrollment of the first study subject.
The research study protocol must specify the method and timing of public release of all prespecified outcomes.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%specifies the method and timing of public release of all prespecified outcomes%'

restrictions.condition: The research study protocol must explicitly discuss subpopulations affected by the treatment, particularly traditionally underrepresented groups in clinical studies.
The research study protocol must explicitly discuss how the results are or are not expected to be generalizable to the Medicare population.
For studies covered under Section I, services must be performed on or after January 9, 2014.
For studies covered under Section I, results must be made public within 24 months of the end of data collection.
For studies covered under Section II, services must be performed on or after December 7, 2016.
PILD procedures must use an FDA-approved/cleared device.
The FDA-approved/cleared device must have completed a CMS-approved randomized control trial (RCT) that met the criteria listed in Section I.
For studies covered under Section II, the study must be a prospective, longitudinal study.
Eligibility (inclusion and exclusion) criteria from the CMS-approved RCT protocol must be maintained in the new prospective, longitudinal study.
All study sites and study results must be listed in the ClinicalTrials.gov database.
Registries for clinical research studies must also be registered in the AHRQ Registry of Patient Registries (RoPR).
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%AHRQ Registry of Patient Registries%'

restrictions.condition: For studies covered under Section II, results must be made public within 12 months of the study’s primary completion date.

Studies conducted under CED must provide and obtain meaningful informed consent from patients regarding the risks associated with the study items and/or services, and the use and eventual disposition of the collected data.
restrictions.rule: clinical_study_design LIKE '%provide and obtain meaningful informed consent%'

restrictions.condition: PILD for LSS is not considered reasonable and necessary under section 1862(a)(1)(A) of the Social Security Act.
Endoscopically assisted laminotomy/laminectomy, which requires open and direct visualization, is not within the scope of this NCD.
Other open lumbar decompression procedures for LSS are not within the scope of this NCD.
Coverage for endoscopically assisted laminotomy/laminectomy and other open lumbar decompression procedures is at contractor discretion.
HCPCS procedure code 0275T for PILD is covered only when the procedure is performed within any other CED approved clinical trial.
restrictions.rule: procedure_code_HCPCS = '0275T' AND coverage_with_evidence_development_flag = TRUE AND clinical_study_enrollment_required = TRUE
